page.title: 13THE GARDEN ESTATE, ARNPRIOR
page.content: The Garden estate employs one gamekeeper to tend the game on 450 acres of woodland, 450 acres of moorland, scrub and mossland, and a loch of 12 acres water surface. Shooting rights are owned by Mr Stakis, a well known hotelier, and fishing rights by Kippen Angling Club. The main game includes partridge, pheasant, grouse, ptarmigan and blackgame. The season extends from August to February, depending on species. There are typically 12 organised shoots per year with perhaps 7 guns and 12 beaters. Birds are brought in as 6 week old poults, reared and released, 40% being shot in a season. Main predators include foxes, crows and weasels, and poachers are a problem. The loch is stocked by 1400 rainbow trout.
